name: Chocolate Marshmallow Cookies
description: Rich and chewy vegan Chocolate Marshmallow Cookies are even better than s'mores! Made in 1 bowl, these double chocolate cookies with chocolate chips and vegan marshmallows are soft, gooey, and decadent.Â
recipeIngredient: 1 cup vegan chocolate chunks or chips
1 cup mini vegan marshmallows (I used Dandies)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

recipeInstructions.text: Melt the vegan butter, then add to a large bowl with the sugar and mix well with a large spoon. Now stir in the vanilla, flaxseeds and soy milk until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Melt the vegan butter, then add to a large bowl with the sugar and mix well with a large spoon. Now stir in the vanilla, flaxseeds and soy milk until well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Over the bowl with the wet ingredients, sift in the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt. Stir to combine. The dough will be quite thick, so you can use your hands if needed. Now fold in the chocolate chips and marshmallows, leaving some to place on top of the cookies for decoration if you want.
recipeInstructions.name: Over the bowl with the wet ingredients, sift in the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt. Stir to combine. The dough will be quite thick, so you can use your hands if needed. Now fold in the chocolate chips and marshmallows, leaving some to place on top of the cookies for decoration if you want.

recipeInstructions.text: Scoop about 2 tablespoons of the dough at a time, roll into a ball, then flatten a bit on the baking sheet. They will spread out more as they bake. Decorate the tops with a few more chocolate chips and marshmallows, if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Scoop about 2 tablespoons of the dough at a time, roll into a ball, then flatten a bit on the baking sheet. They will spread out more as they bake. Decorate the tops with a few more chocolate chips and marshmallows, if desired.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for about 10 minutes. They will seem too soft, but will firm up as they cool. Let them cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for about 10 minutes. They will seem too soft, but will firm up as they cool. Let them cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely.

recipeInstructions.text: To make the marshmallows really toasty, use a kitchen blow torch to lightly toast them.
recipeInstructions.name: To make the marshmallows really toasty, use a kitchen blow torch to lightly toast them.
